text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro, welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

I got so many requests for something Harry
Potter, so today I will be making
Chocolate Frogs! Harry Potter Chocolate Frogs.

Today is gonna super easy, because all you
will need will be: Rice Krispies,

I’m pointing with my Wizard wand because
this is fun, chocolate melts, you’re gonna

need the light cocoa, not the dark cocoa,
and the brand that I use is the Wilton.

That’s the way to go! And gummy frogs, you
can find these at basically any

grocery store. And, from your bakings store
you will need chocolate frog mold tray.
Let’s get started!

The first thing that we’re going to do is
take the chocolate melts and microwave

them, and then we’re going to put them into
a plastic bag. You can also heat these

on the stove if you would like. Once you’ve
placed your chocolate in the bag, all

you’re gonna do is cut the tip, meep! With
some baking scissors. And then
you’re gonna fill the frog trays only 1/2.
1/2 way. Here we go!

Make sure that when you’re putting in the
chocolate you’re pressing down a lot so

that it’s gonna get in all the little nicks
and crooks and crannies.
Weroooo!

Once your little frogs are 1/2 way full, we’re
gonna stick in gummies,

we have our gummy frogs right here, into 1/2
of them, and then the other 1/2

we’re gonna do Rice Krispies to make them
cruncy.

So there’s the little gummy, boop! Frogs
inside of frogs!

And then, little Rice Krispies, make sure
it just gets on the chocolate.
Boom!

Once you’ve put in your gummy frogs and
your Rice Krispies, you’re gonna put them
in the freezer for about 5 minutes.
Da-new!

They just came out of the freezer, and now
we’re gonna fill them the other 1/2
with our chocolate.

And you might have to re-heat your chocolate
in the microwave or whatever,
that’s fine!

Try to make them flat, but if you can’t,
that’s OK! It doesn’t need to be perfect.

Then if you want to you can take a knife and
kind of flatten it out.

You don’t have to though, I’m just trying
to be fancy.

Alright, chocolate frogs are full, We're gonna
put it back in the freezer for

about 10 minutes this time, and then we’ll
have Chocolate Harry Potter Frogs!
Mmmmm!

Ta-da! I just took them out of the freezer
and they’re really easy to get out.

Kinda bend the tray just a little bit, and
then find the edge and
just gently lift up. Da-da!
Here we go first Chocolate Frog!

You do have to be a little bit careful, but
they’ve taken their shape,
so it should be fine!

And ta-da! Harry Potter Chocolate Frogs! These
were so easy to make, and the

ones with the Rice Krispies, they really taste
like a crunch bar or something and

the ones with the gummies, I don’t know
what they taste like, but I like ‘em!
They’re super yummy! Dee-dee!

Oh, they’re so cute! Thanks you guys for
watching, if you have any other suggestions

for any other Nerdy Nummies, please let me
know, please leave me a comment below

and I will do my best to make them happen.
And this is Halloween month, October,

my favorite month, so if you have any spooky
ideas, please leave those comments
because I want to do those!
OK, bye-bye!
